intro: Limonium smithii, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and silver-gray foliage, which are adapted to thrive in salty, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as dunes and coastal grasslands. Limonium smithii is known for its long-lasting blooms, making it a popular choice in gardens and floral arrangements. Its ability to tolerate harsh maritime conditions makes it an important part of coastal ecosystems.
